title: 2D motion - graphs of x and y components of a

content.question: An object starts at rest and then moves in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math> plane with the components of acceleration <math alttext="a sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="a sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> each varying as represented by the acceleration-time graph shown. At what time or times during the time interval shown is (are) the magnitude of the acceleration at a maximum, and what reasoning supports this claim?

choices.label: At <math alttext="t equals the fraction t sub f, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. The product <math alttext="a sub x, end sub, times a sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> is at its greatest value.

At <math alttext="t equals the fraction t sub f, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. <math alttext="a sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="a sub y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub></math> are equal in magnitude.

At <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. <math alttext="the absolute value of a sub x, minus a sub y, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><mo>âˆ’</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mo>|</mo></math> is at its greatest value.

At <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. <math alttext="a sub x, end sub, squared, plus a sub y, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math> is at its greatest value.

content.answer: At <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. <math alttext="a sub x, end sub, squared, plus a sub y, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math> is at its greatest value.
